programme.title: The Young Poisoner's Handbook
programme.desc: A shy teenage outcast (Hugh O'Conor) uses his chemistry genius to poison his family and others in '60s England.

programme.title: Sabrina the Teenage Witch
programme.desc: The new girl (Melissa Joan Hart) in school gains strange powers which mean track stardom, a popular boyfriend and alienation from those who care about her.

programme.title: Bloodfist VIII: Hard Way Out
programme.desc: A teen (John Patrick White) learns his nerdy math-teacher father (Don "The Dragon" Wilson) is an ex-CIA operative hunted by assassins.

programme.title: Living in Oblivion
programme.desc: A harried director must contend with technical foul-ups and actors' shenanigans on the set of a low-budget film.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: Joey tries to reunite a crack addict with her seriously ill infant.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: The Jump Street unit locates a newscaster's missing daughter and discovers that she may be implicated in a murder.

programme.title: The Storyteller: Greek Myths
programme.desc: Perseus defeats the monster Gorgon and fulfills a prophecy.

programme.title: The Storyteller: Greek Myths
programme.desc: Orpheus pursues Eurydice to the underworld.

programme.title: The Storyteller: Greek Myths
programme.desc: An Athenian prince battles a half-man, half-bull monstrosity.

programme.title: The Storyteller: Greek Myths
programme.desc: Icarus flies too close to the sun.

programme.title: Space Precinct
programme.desc: Criminals determine to control Demeter City's energy franchise.

programme.title: Space Precinct
programme.desc: A crooked fight-promoter uses drugs to turn a frightened illegal immigrant into a savage.

programme.title: The Weird Al Show
programme.desc: Al takes a correspondence course so he can be as smart as the Hooded Avenger.

programme.title: The Weird Al Show
programme.desc: Al turns his best friend into a giant rodent; musical guest Hanson.

programme.title: The Weird Al Show
programme.desc: Al baby-sits his boss's nasty nephew.

programme.title: The Weird Al Show
programme.desc: The prize for Al's annual talent show, an ice sculpture of Marvin the Seabass, melts; musical guest Immature.

programme.title: Pacific Blue
programme.desc: While on a stakeout, T.C. and Chris are brought closer together; Palermo's name is discovered in a Hollywood madam's phone book.

programme.title: Pacific Blue
programme.desc: The bike patrol discovers a runaway, only to realize she had every reason to escape her family; Cory's brother is the target of a hit man.

programme.title: Pee-wee's Playhouse
programme.desc: Pee-wee's Christmas wish list becomes so long that Santa will run out of presents for all the other kids in the world; when Santa Claus pleads for help, Pee-wee reluctantly learns a lesson about the true meaning of Christmas.

programme.title: Affliction
programme.desc: A small-town sheriff (Nick Nolte) becomes unhinged, thanks in part to his abusive, alcoholic father (James Coburn).

programme.title: Welcome Home, Roxy Carmichael
programme.desc: An offbeat Ohio teenager (Winona Ryder) eagerly awaits the return of a legendary wild one she figures is her mother.

programme.title: Hitman
programme.desc: A fast talker (Eric Tsang) engages a Hong Kong rube (Jet Li) to track down the assassin of a sleazy Japanese businessman.

programme.title: Point Break
programme.desc: An FBI agent (Keanu Reeves) turns California surfer to nab bank robbers who wear rubber masks of four ex-presidents.

programme.title: The Lawnmower Man: Director's Cut
programme.desc: A scientist uses an intellectually disabled gardener as a guinea pig in his experiments with intelligence enhancing drugs and virtual reality. The man transforms into a genius, but not without side effects.
